intro: Euphrasia minima subsp. davisii, commonly known as Davis's lesser eyebright, is a small annual herb native to the western United States. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. The plant has delicate, hairy stems and small, yellowish-green flowers with two lips. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs. It is part of the Scrophulariaceae family, known for its medicinal and ornamental species.
